body_content.explanation: relating to or involving calculations or guesses about the future:
examples: The five-year plan was a projective document intended for internal management use only.
We have to reduce our projective emissions growth, because otherwise the climate will be in serious trouble.

body_content.explanation: relating to or involving the way a line, figure, or solid is shown on a given plane (= a flat or level surface that continues in all directions):
examples: V will denote a flat projective scheme over B.
They questioned the dominance of perspective as a projective representation of proposed architecture.

body_content.explanation: relating to or involving projection (= the act of encouraging someone to express their feelings and desires):
examples: Projective techniques are based on Freudian theory.
The illustrations were specifically designed to be projective in nature.

body_content.explanation: relating to or involving projection (= the act of imagining that someone else feels a particular emotion or wants something when in fact it is you who feels this way):
examples: The more one partner complains about the behaviour of the other, the more likely it is that a projective system is in operation.
We noted his projective criticism of the project and its contributors.
